name: Steak Kabobs
description: My steak kabobs are bold and zesty, stacking tender steak and veggies in each bite. This 4 ingredient steak kabob marinade is a family fave!
ingredients: ½ cup extra virgin olive oil
1½ pounds sirloin steak or similar, cubed in one inch pieces
1 yellow bell pepper cut into 1-inch pieces
12 ounces fresh mushrooms halved or whole
instructions: In a rectangular dish (or medium mixing bowl), whisk together the oil, balsamic vinegar, garlic and fresh cracked pepper. Place the steak in the bowl with the marinade (or in a large Ziplock bag). Marinate 1+ hour, up to 4-6 hours refrigerated, covered. Assemble kabobs by carefully threading the marinated steak and veggies, alternating along the bamboo skewer. Leave a little space between ingredients to allow them to cook evenly on the grill. (I like to brush the assembled kabobs with remaining marinade right back in my baking dish, before discarding the marinade when I place them on the grill.) Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Brush olive oil onto the grate. Add steak kabobs to grill. For steak prepared medium (140°–145°F), grill 2 minutes per side for a total of 8 minutes.
